org.eclipse.incquery.runtime.api

Class IncQueryEngineManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.eclipse.incquery.runtime.api.IncQueryEngineManager

  • public class IncQueryEngineManager
extends java.lang.Object
    Global registry of active EMF-IncQuery engines.

    Manages an IncQueryEngine for each EMF model, that is created on demand. Managed engines are shared between clients querying the same EMF model.

    It is also possible to create private, unmanaged engines that are not shared between clients.

    Only weak references are retained on the managed engines. So if there are no other references to the matchers or the engine, they can eventually be GC'ed, and they won't block the EMF model from being GC'ed either.

    Author:
    Bergmann Gabor

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static IncQueryEngineManager getInstance()
        Returns:
        the singleton instance

      • getIncQueryEngine

        public IncQueryEngine getIncQueryEngine(org.eclipse.emf.common.notify.Notifier emfRoot)
                                 throws IncQueryException
        Creates a managed EMF-IncQuery engine at an EMF model root (recommended: Resource or ResourceSet) or retrieves an already existing one. Repeated invocations for a single model root will return the same engine. Consequently, the engine will be reused between different clients querying the same model, providing performance benefits.

        The scope of pattern matching will be the given EMF model root and below (see FAQ for more precise definition). The match set of any patterns will be incrementally refreshed upon updates from this scope.

        Parameters:
        emfRoot - the root of the EMF containment hierarchy where this engine should operate. Recommended: Resource or ResourceSet.
        Returns:
        a new or previously existing engine
        Throws:
        IncQueryException

      • getIncQueryEngineIfExists

        public IncQueryEngine getIncQueryEngineIfExists(org.eclipse.emf.common.notify.Notifier emfRoot)
        Retrieves an already existing managed EMF-IncQuery engine.
        Parameters:
        emfRoot - the root of the EMF containment hierarchy where this engine operates.
        Returns:
        a previously existing engine, or null if no engine is active for the given EMF model root

      • getExistingIncQueryEngines

        public java.util.Set<IncQueryEngine> getExistingIncQueryEngines()
        Collects all IncQueryEngine instances that still exist.
        Returns:
        set of engines if there is any, otherwise EMTPY_SET

      • createAdvancedIncQueryEngine

        @Deprecated
public AdvancedIncQueryEngine createAdvancedIncQueryEngine(org.eclipse.emf.common.notify.Notifier emfRoot)
                                                    throws IncQueryException
        Deprecated. use AdvancedIncQueryEngine.createUnmanagedEngine(Notifier)
        Creates a new advanced and unmanaged EMF-IncQuery engine at an EMF model root (recommended: Resource or ResourceSet). Repeated invocations will return different instances, so other clients are unable to independently access and influence the returned engine. Note that unmanaged engines do not benefit from some performance improvements that stem from sharing incrementally maintained indices and caches.

        Client is responsible for the lifecycle of the returned engine, hence the usage of the advanced interface AdvancedIncQueryEngine.

        The scope of pattern matching will be the given EMF model root and below (see FAQ for more precise definition). The match set of any patterns will be incrementally refreshed upon updates from this scope.

        Parameters:
        emfRoot - the root of the EMF containment hierarchy where this engine should operate. Recommended: Resource or ResourceSet.
        Returns:
        a new existing engine
        Throws:
        IncQueryException

      • disposeEngine

        @Deprecated
public boolean disposeEngine(org.eclipse.emf.common.notify.Notifier emfRoot)
        Deprecated. use engine.dispose() instead
        Disconnects an unmanaged engine.

        The engine will not impose on the model its update overhead anymore. If no references are retained to the matchers or the engine, GC'ing the engine and its caches is presumably made easier, although (due to weak references) a dispose() call is not strictly necessary.

        If the engine is managed (see IncQueryEngine#isManaged()), there may be other clients using it. Such engines will not be disposed.

        Returns:
        true is an engine was found and disconnected, false if no engine was found for the given root.

      • addIncQueryEngineInitializationListener

        public void addIncQueryEngineInitializationListener(IncQueryEngineInitializationListener listener)
        Registers a listener for new engine initialization.

        For removal, use removeIncQueryEngineInitializationListener(org.eclipse.incquery.runtime.api.IncQueryEngineInitializationListener)

        Parameters:
